site_name: Land North Of Norwood Bottom Lock (Lock 91), Grand Union Canal
description: Creation of a community garden on land next to Norwood Bottom Lock, and new stepped and ramped accesses from the canal to Glade Lane Canalside Park, as part of the Grand Union Canal Wellbeing Way
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers and documents: 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-28-C: Existing & Proposed Section CS 17; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-29-C:Location plan; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-30-C:TOWPATH DETAIL - UNBOUND STONE TIMBER EDGE; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-31-C:Side Elevation; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-32-C:750 Litre Water Butt; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-33-C:Veg Trug Planter Natural Wood Medium; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-34-C: Frond Pergola; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-35-C: Standard planter; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-24-D: Block Plan; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-25-C: TIMBER ACCESS STEPS; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-26-C: Existing & Proposed Section CS 13; 11575-CRT-GU-214-003-27-C: Existing & Proposed Section CS 14; Landscape ecological Plan; Design and access statement; Illustirive drawings; Preliminary ecology appraisal; Heritage impact assesment REV 3
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
